intro: Rudgea tanaosepala, commonly known as the tanaosepala rudgea, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Rudgea tanaosepala is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and streamside areas.
